result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse K. Christiansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/treatment or combination, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours community service per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription, and taken only as prescribed. 

No contact with victim, K.M.C. unless approved by agent.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA and follow up. 

SAFE program, intake and assessment with follow through. 

60/90/120 day probation review hearings. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rule violations.
I/S to be used for rule violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse K. Christiansen

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  1:18 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CM282, 22CM349.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
DOC Agent, Andy Thurs, appears in person.

Date and time set for probation review hearing. 
COURT questions defendant re: probation status.  
Defendant makes statement.  

Department is requesting another review hearing in 60 days. 

Next hearing>>Probation review hearing 12/16/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  1:19 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse K. Christiansen
Current: 578 Leroy St, Edgar, WI 54426 United States  (Effective: 08-18-2022)
Prior: 590 Cameron Street, Edgar, WI 54426
Probation review hearing on October 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Transcript - Plea & Sentencing - 8/9/22 - State v. Christiansen

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:50 a.m. 
INCLUDES 22CM282, 22CM317, 22CM349, 22CM350. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

22CM317>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order-Injunction/DA); COURT GRANTS.

22CM350>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order-Temporary Restraining Order); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA: 

22CM282>>Count 1 (Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order-Temporary Restraining Order); NO CONTEST.  

22CM349>>Count 1 (Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order-Temporary Restraining Order);  NO CONTEST.  
22CM349>>Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on all counts: SWH for 1 year probation; concurrent with each other. 

CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program, intake and assessment with follow through.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain FTW/School/treatment or combination, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. No contact with victim, K.M.C. unless approved by agent.  60/90/120 day probation review hearings.  30 days MCJ I/S to be used for rule violations.  10 hours community service I/S to be used for rule violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharges.  COURT grants 2 days credit on 22CM349 if revoked. 

Probation review hearing>>10/07/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj: 10:07 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 09:50 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
